>; 是 <a href="https://cocalc.com">;CoCalc</a>; 的直接竞争对手之一。今天（2023 年 11 月 30 日）<a href="https://deepnote.com/changelog/2023-11-30#reduced-machine-prices">;他们宣布大幅降价</a>; -you-go 费率：</p>; <blockquote>; <p>;<em>;“正如您可能已经听说的，从 12 月 1 日开始，我们将大幅削减所有机器的即用即付费率 – 使得它们对预算更友好，没有任何隐藏条款。”</em>;</p>; </blockquote>; <br>; <img>; <br>; <p>;在 CoCalc，我们最近<a href="https://github Improving Accessibility in JupyterLab</stitle>;<updated>;2022-11-28T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/zoom-a11y-jupyterlab"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Kulsoom Zahra learns about accessibility and fixes a part of the JupyterLab interface (that used to break when zoomed in) during her summer 2022 internship at Quansight Labs.</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-11-18:/ff7c1de8f1bfcb1a5093bb16589ba4f7cdc1ff92210dd02758242b1626a09305</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Introducing the Spyder-Watchlist plugin</stitle>;<updated>;2022-11-18T12:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Spyder Blog</name>;<uri>;https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/introducing-watchlist-plugin/"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;Spyder's Variable Explorer is a great tool which aids the development and debugging of Python code by displaying all variables from the current scope. One thing the Variable Explorer is missing is the ability to display the value of arbitrary, user-definable expressions while debugging. For example, it might be useful to see the value of a specific attribute of an object, or the value of an array at some index. Such a feature is known as a "watchlist" or "watches" in other Integrated Development Environments (IDEs). This blog post introduces the Watchlist plugin developed for Spyder.</p>; Features <p>;The watchlist consists of a user-definable list of expressions. They are evaluated after each debugger step, and the result of the evaluation is displayed as a string. This means that <code>;value = str(eval(expression))</code>; is performed behind the scenes, and the result is shown in the plugin. The watchlist is a very powerful tool, but this comes at a cost: Any side effect of an expression will affect the execution environment.</p>; <p>;Expressions can be</p>; <a href="https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/introducing-watchlist-plugin/">;(continued...)</a>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-11-15:/9c3638146ce40c9a2b94d97467a99be9d4906466993b23e61630e468b59cd9f0</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Por que abandonamos os blogs?</stitle>;<updated>;2022-11-15T02:42:48Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Filipe Saraiva's blog</name>;<uri>;https://blog.filipesaraiva.info</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://blog.filipesaraiva.info/?p=2274"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Interface de escrita do Twitter Estamos nesses dias assistindo o Elon Musk destruir o Twitter. However, these techniques are much less common for <a href="/blog/2018/notes-on-the-frank-wolfe-algorithm-part-i/">;Frank-Wolfe-like</a>; algorithms. In this blog post I …</p>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-08-07:/5743a0857284f096ccb6741d52fd9f26353eb2bbb99df3e7375eb0cd219a11dd</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Introducing the 2022 Interns Cohort</stitle>;<updated>;2022-08-07T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/introducing-intern-cohort-2022"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Quansight Labs is delighted to welcome its second cohort of 6 interns, who will work on a variety of open source projects and tasks</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-07-25:/647da99ffb7ec264f1cd37077b508e5d897939f66d40ceb9c5f749f70d998efe</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;New 2022 roadmap and grant funding</stitle>;<updated>;2022-07-25T12:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Spyder Blog</name>;<uri>;https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/spyder-roadmap-proposals-2022/"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;For the last couple of months, the Spyder team has been working on defining a new roadmap and submitting grant proposals to fund more features and improvements. We are pleased to announce our roadmap for the rest of 2022, and that two proposals were funded!</p>; The roadmap <p>;Considering the importance of sharing a clear perspective of where the Spyder project is going and where we will be focusing our efforts over the coming months, the team has created <a href="https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/wiki/Roadmap">;an initial roadmap for the rest of 2022</a>;. We prioritized the highlighted features and enhancements based on input from issues, face-to-face and virtual discussions, Stack Overflow, social media and other feedback, to try to best capture the interests of our users and community.</p>; The proposals <p>;To help make our roadmap achievable, we wrote and submitted proposals to several different venues and organizations in the last couple of months. While we have yet to hear back from some of them, two have already been funded!</p>; <p>;The first was for the</p>; <a href="https://www.spyder-ide.org/blog/spyder-roadmap-proposals-2022/">;(continued...)</a>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-07-13:/65021f821cc46f1b0cda707a017fe5ea67b4e4fb9d17fcc8ec5167f716a9ff94</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;SciPy 2022 Accessibility Awareness Programs</stitle>;<updated>;2022-07-13T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/alt-text-scipy-2022"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Announcing the SciPy 2022 Accessibility Awareness Efforts</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-07-13:/9c78fd336ef3fa717c3842429d509d95cc593adddb2b05204cd97dba8c5fd2b6</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;The Value of Open Source Sprints, the scikit-learn Experience</stitle>;<updated>;2022-07-13T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;scikit-learn Blog</name>;<uri>;https://blog.scikit-learn.org/</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://blog.scikit-learn.org/events/sprints-value/"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Author: Reshama Shaikh</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-07-11:/169e30a656bfb0ab4a34748e51a758f8a8d7e2e6af6a65dbc741c34df928926b</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Pollution in India : Real-time AQI Data</stitle>;<updated>;2022-07-11T16:05:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;ListenData</name>;<uri>;https://www.listendata.com/search/label/Python</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://www.listendata.com/2022/07/pollution-in-india-real-time-aqi-data.html"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;Air pollution has become a serious problem in recent years across the world. Effects of Air Pollution is devastating and its harmful effects are not just limited to Humans but also animals and plants as well. It also leads to global warming which is esentially increasing air and ocean temperatures around the world.</p>; <p>;Indian cities have been topping the list of polluted cities. In order to solve the problem of air pollution the most important thing is to track air pollution on real-time basis first which alerts people to avoid outdoor activities during high air Pollution. This post explains how you can fetch real-time Air Quality Index (AQI) of Indian cities using Python and R code. It allows both Python and R programmers to pull pollution data.</p>; <img>; <p>;You can download the <a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/deepanshu88/Datasets/master/UploadedFiles/stations.csv">;dataset</a>; which contains static information about Indian states, cities and AQI stations. Variables stored in this dataset will be used further to fetch real-time data. </p>; <pre>;<code>; </code>;</pre>; <a href="https://www.listendata.com/2022/07/pollution-in-india-real-time-aqi-data.html">;(continued...)</a>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-07-09:/a7a6ffb5ae09288dc19e59c97ce35ee0bccfa35252ca675a7dfe6955e9dec713</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;My Mayavi story: discovering open source communities</stitle>;<updated>;2022-07-09T22:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Gaël Varoquaux - programming</name>;<uri>;https://gael-varoquaux.info/</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://gael-varoquaux.info/programming/my-mayavi-story-discovering-open-source-communities.html"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;<em>;The Mayavi Python software, and my personal history: A thread on Python and scipy ecosystems, building open source codebase, and meeting really cool and friendly people</em>;</p>; <img>; <p>;I am writing today as a goodbye to the project: I used to be one of the core contributors and maintainers but have been …</p>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-06-30:/6e74c86ed8127e22594e4ebfa1af7623d58f5792b9c48a86fc26a46029725e61</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Pointwise mutual information (PMI) in NLP</stitle>;<updated>;2022-06-30T14:04:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;ListenData</name>;<uri>;https://www.listendata.com/search/label/Python</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://www.listendata.com/2022/06/pointwise-mutual-information-pmi.html"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<p>;Natural Language Processing (NLP) has secured so much acceptance recently as there are many live projects running and now it's not just limited to academics only. Use cases of NLP can be seen across industries like understanding customers' issues, predicting the next word user is planning to type in the keyboard, automatic text summarization etc. Many researchers across the world trained NLP models in several human languages like English, Spanish, French, Mandarin etc so that benefit of NLP can be seen in every society. In this post we will talk about one of the most useful NLP metric called Pointwise mutual information (PMI) to identify words that can go together along with its implementation in Python and R.</p>; <div>; <span>;<b>;Table of Contents</b>;</span>; </div>; <hr>; <div>; What is Pointwise mutual information? <p>;PMI helps us to find related words. In other words, it explains how likely the co-occurrence of two words than we would expect by chance. For example the word "Data Science" has a specific meaning when these</p>;</div>; <a href="https://www.listendata.com/2022/06/pointwise-mutual-information-pmi.html">;(continued...)</a>;</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-06-24:/8776fd6375fdc717a313c1ee98fff88fd522fd34aac76b479ea1e3bac7c33cab</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;How to import your data into Acoular</stitle>;<updated>;2022-06-24T05:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Acoular</name>;<uri>;https://acoular.github.io/blog/</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://acoular.github.io/blog/2022/06/24/convert-input-data.html"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;Acoular is a Python library that processes multichannel data (up to a few hundred channels) from acoustic measurements with a microphone array which is stored in an HDF5 file. This blog post explains how to convert data available in other formats into this file format. As examples for other file formats we will use both .csv (comma separated text files) and .mat (Matlab files).</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-06-06:/47029320f1b32b9fd009efe29dad535b81f0d1cf50426b188d8f61c4e7bb5e36</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;Checking for accessibility: thoughts and a checklist!</stitle>;<updated>;2022-06-06T00:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Quansight Labs</name>;<uri>;https://labs.quansight.org</uri>;</author>;<link href="https://labs.quansight.org/blog/thoughts-on-reviewing-for-accessibility"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;A non-exhaustive but totally honest checklist for accessibility review</content>;</entry>;<entry>;<id>;tag:planet.scipy.org,2022-05-26:/cd7aaf2519667c41f0ea0986650f7d014073527275c853d5aa3ebca4ae4df8c7</id>;<title xml:lang="en">;On the Link Between Optimization and Polynomials, Part 5</stitle>;<updated>;2022-05-26T22:00:00Z</updated>;<author>;<name>;Keep the gradient flowing</name>;<uri>;http://fa.bianp.net/</uri>;</author>;<link href="http://fa.bianp.net/blog/2022/cyclical/"/>;<content type="html" xml:lang="en">;<blockquote>; <p>; <br>;<i>; <b>;Six</b>;: All of this has happened before. <br>; <b>;Baltar</b>;: But the question remains, does all of this have to happen again?<br>; <b>;Six</b>;: This time I bet no.<br>; <b>;Baltar</b>;: You know, I've never known you to play the optimist.
